poem:
Title: "Upon Rafah's Mourning"

Rafah's breath hangs heavy, weighted with sorrow.
The hand of humanity is idling,
Spectating as life's candle is snuffed, 
Amidst a tempest wrought by squabbling gods.
Courage sheds its mantle in the gaze of armoured might,
Vigilant eye scanning the martyr's horizon.
In Rafah's dying throes, mankind's blush is hidden;
Our silence echoes louder than the tempest's thunder.
